createLearningGoal.title: Create a new Learning Goal
createLearningGoal.titlePlaceholder: Give the learning goal a title
createLearningGoal.titleRequiredValidationError: A learning goal needs to have a title
createLearningGoal.titleMaxLengthValidationError: A learning goal title is limited to 255 characters
createLearningGoal.titleUniqueValidationError: There already exists a learning goal with this title in the course
createLearningGoal.descriptionPlaceholder: Describe the learning goal. What do you expect students to learn?
createLearningGoal.descriptionMaxLengthValidationError: A learning goal description is limited to 10 000 characters
createLearningGoal.connectWithLectureUnits: Connect the learning goal with lecture units

learningGoalCard.connectedLectureUnitsExplanation: The following lecture units are connected to this learning goal:
learningGoalCard.exerciseNote: Please note that we take always the last submission into account for exercise units. Even submissions after the due date. This means for example that you can improve your progress by re-trying a quiz as often as you like. It is therefore normal, that the score here might differ from the score you officially achieved in an exercise.

delete.question: Do you really want to delete the learning goal {{ title }}? You can not undo this action!
delete.typeNameToConfirm: Please enter the name of the learning goal for confirmation.

learningGoalCard.progressUnavailable: Progress calculation is currently only available for learning goals connected to lecture units.
learningGoalCard.noUnitsConnected: This learning goal is not connected to any lecture units
learningGoalCard.progressExplanation: Progress: You achieved currently {{ progress }}% of {{ points }} points
learningGoalCard.progressCourseExplanation: Average Course Progress: The course achieved currently on average {{ progress }}% of {{ points }} points

learningGoalPopover.explanation: This lecture unit helps you to achieve the following learning goals:
learningGoalPopover.noLearningGoals: No learning goals are connected with this lecture unit!
